item.title: Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2008

latestAction.text: On motion to refer the bill and the accompanying veto message to the Committee on Appropriations. Agreed to without objection.

item.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216 - 182 (Roll no. 1048). (text: CR H12802)
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 216 - 182 (Roll no. 1048).(text: CR H12802)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 218 - 183 (Roll no. 1047). (consideration: CR H12812-12813)
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 794.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H12802-12805, H12806-12814)
Will the House now consider the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 203 - 178 (Roll no. 1044).

POINT OF ORDER - Mr. Flake raised a point of order against the provisions of H. Res. 794 because it waived all points of order against the conference report to accompany H.R. 3043. The Chair announced that the disposition of the point of order would be resolved by the question of consideration of H. Res. 794. The House proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the point of order at the end of which the Chair will put the question on consideration.
By direction of the Committee on Rules, Mr. Hastings (FL) called up H. Res. 794 and asked for its immediate consideration.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 146.
Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 3043.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-427, by Mr. Hastings (FL).
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-427, by Mr. Hastings (FL).

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 3043) making appropriations for the Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2008.

Waives points of order against consideration of the conference report on H.R. 3043 (Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2008).

Makes a motion to proceed to consideration of H.R. 3688 (United States-Peru Trade Promotion Agreement Implementation Act) in order only if offered by the Majority Leader or his designee.

Waives points of order against consideration of the conference report on H.R. 3043 (Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2008).

Makes a motion to proceed to consideration of H.R. 3688 (United States-Peru Trade Promotion Agreement Implementation Act) in order only if offered by the Majority Leader or his designee.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 3043) making appropriations for the Departments of Labor, Health and Human Services, and Education, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2008, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
